Brave heroes become entangled in dire affairs as terrible events unfold around them. Only by following the corruption to its hideous source and confronting the terrible powers that lurk behind it can the heroes hope to triumph. But is it too late for them already?

Light & Dark is the next installment in Reality Blurs' Old School Fantasy line of adventure modules. Hearken back to the days of legend and lore, when your spells, swords, and smarts alone kept the forces of evil at bay.

108957.name: GreyMesa
108957.description:
From publisher website

The RunePunk Guidebook series details out the various districts and barrens comprising ScatterPoint.

In Guidebook #1, we turn our attention to GreyMesa. Learn the secret history of the City. Explore the ten boroughs. Learn what makes the citizens proud and what brings countless jobbers to the District of Dark Hope looking to improve their lot in life.

Full of adventure hooks, new factions, and more for the Dark Steampunk Fantasy like no other!

108958.name: BentShadow
108958.description:
From publisher website

Wander into the Bleakness!

Guidebook 2: BentShadow is our first expansion into the barrens, those not-quite-so desolate lands beyond the safety of the City's walls. Explore BentShadow and find out what secrets lurk within this ruined barrens. Discover the truth behind the Estate's connection to the City and more. We present this in our signature, streamlined digest size for easy reading on your computer or on the go!

108959.name: WormWood
108959.description:
From publisher website

WormWood is the district where civilization intersects with the Old World, a place where ancient, petrified trees reach skyward, overshadowed by immense towers, and surrounded by spiraling rail lines. The shadows run deep throughout WormWood. Are the jobbers brave enough to penetrate the perpetual twilight and discover what secrets lay hidden within its depths?

We present this in our signature, streamlined digest size for easy reading on your computer or on the go!

108960.name: The GearLost Vale
108960.description:
From publisher website

The GearLost Vale is a rolling expanse of myth and mystery, little explored until late. Many have disappeared within its depths, whether by going to prove their bravery or by seeking redemption for past deeds. The promise of blood now causes travelers to again venture into this sparse land and the din of crowds echo from the coliseums and across the lands. Will your jobbers see for themselves what treasures await them, hidden, in the GearLost Vale?

We present this in our signature, streamlined digest size for easy reading on your computer or on the go!

108961.name: Morpheus: The Roleplaying System of the Mind's Eye! (Boxed Set)
108961.description:
Designer's Notes

First off, thank you for buying this game! It represents over three years of work, including a considerable amount of play testing by a large number of people.

One of the key results I was looking for when designing Morpheus was to have a playable, enjoyable game that was very full without forcing the person who wants to play to read 50 book with 150 pages each in them. I think that I have achieved this. The idea to base Morpheus on dreams was made from the very start and the entire game was designed around dreams. Initially, Morpheus was strictly a two player game, where one person would set up the "dream" and another person would travel through it. This worked well enough but lacked the excitement and fun of multi-player games, and so I began looking around for ideas to help incorporate multiple players into a single dream sequence. Eventually the Morpheus "Mind Park" was formed, and things really began to move then. Although in the Mind Park you are not truly dreaming the adventures that you partake in, it does all exist in your head, and the level of imagination you can muster is a key factor to your survivability. Because you adventure in computer generated worlds that exist only in your head reality kind of has the tendency to go flying out the window, and this opens up immense possibilities for the gamer. When writing the rules for Morpheus, I did not try to simulate reality at all, which is why I don't need as many rules as most of the other games. The rules you see are merely guidelines set down by Gaming Central at Morpheus, not an attempt to duplicate the real world on paper. This is why you won't find immense tables dealing with the amount and kind of spells a second level prist an cast ... I simply didn't need them.

Referees should find themselves totally free to create what they will. The only restrictions put on a Referee is that he be consistent, and make the game reasonably fair and possible to win. Other than that, he can do pretty much whatever he wants. If a refereee wants to make a wizard that can turn people into frogs 4 times a day with no chance of missing, then so be it!

Also, the possibility of playing characters that are not necessarily connected to the adventrue that they are participating in is very interesting to me, and to everyone who has played. I happen have a character called "Mr.Big" who is sort of pseudo 1930's gangster, and he has been in adventures in fantasy/magic worlds and it was a lot of fun! Most of the natives perceived him as an eccentric but powerful wizard with some odd habits and a funny accent.

In any event, enjoy yourself! The things that you can do with Morpheus is almost endless and I hope you have fun with it for a long, long time!

(Verbatim from Designer's Notes in the boxed edition)

108962.name: ChalkChain
108962.description:
From publisher website

Ready for ChalkChain? Bring out your dead! With the rare exception of an andari, people die across ScatterPoint each and every day. Most citizens wind up in ChalkChain which is known as the Dead District and the Last Stop. People come frequently to mourn their losses or to do genealogical research at the Hall of Records. What secrets will the jobbers find beyond the false facades and formaldehyde?

We present this in our signature, streamlined digest size for easy reading on your computer or on the go!

108963.name: City Condemned
108963.description:
User Summary

A title available for the XBL Indie Marketplace. You are a sniper on the roof of a building, protect other survivors on other buildings or on the ground by shooting zombies before they reach them, while fending off bats attacking you. Upgrade your weapon and choose between different modes of play before each round, such as headshots only count and turn off and on the attacking bats.

108964.name: Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game
108964.description:
Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game - an action-packed game of survival and Zombie combat.

Can your band of survivors escape the Zombie-infested village of Endicott before the town falls victim to an eradicating nuclear purge? Or will you become infected by the Undead and turn on your allies? The possibilities are endless in a game that utilizes randomization and custom structure mechanics that immerse players in a completely fresh scenario with every new round of play.

Based on the ENDICOTT EPIDEMIC multi-media series created by filmmaker and author Douglas Harvey, Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game is the first full board game that accompanies the Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion card game. While Infectious Contagion was the condensed, "lite" version of the main game, EE:TBG is an epic battle for survival that offers all of the insane mechanics and suspenseful buildup to destruction that the card game couldn't bring to the table (literally).

Utilizing game boards acting as maps based on primary areas of the Endicott Epidemic story (with fully functional expansion "connections" to mix and match your favorite ares as the game expands), players will drop their chosen characters (each with their own unique abilities that can be used strategically) into the heart of the epidemic and begin battling the Undead using classic roll-and-move mechanics as well as a series of unique "Intrique" cubes that modify gameplay with every roll. A deck of Inquest cards act as side-missions that can be ignored or completed to gain resources used to fight and survive, or to gain special tokens that can be used in many different combinations to unlock new areas of play as the game progresses.

Combat is as simple as choosing your weapon (or brawling unarmed, if you so choose) and rolling the Combat Cubes. Each face of each cube means a different value, giving you numerous combinations of attack to dish out against your chosen enemy. But while rolling the cubes is the simple part, bear in mind that your enemies can (and most of the time *will*) fight back or dodge your attack entirely. Strategize your plan of action before engaging the enemy to give you the best course through the hordes of Undead. Or, if you think you have the stealth abilities to do so, roll the dice to try to evade the groups of enemies and slip through unnoticed and live to fight another turn.

But beware - hidden with the game's deck of cards lay numerous deadly obstacles ranging from stronger than average 'Boss' Zombies, Black Ops agents, and even a handful of mutant Hazard Zombies, which spread MBI's toxic plume everywhere they go. Once these villains begin to appear, the spreading plume is something the Survivors must be extremely wary of. Plume markers begin to build in each area and once they reach their critical mass, deadly chain reactions are caused that could potentially wipe out every living thing on the board. The biggest and most brutal enemy within the deck, however, is the Countdown - eight cards that constantly remind players of the impending nuclear purge. Once the eighth and final card is drawn, the game is over - regardless of whether or not the survivors have completed their mission to find the Hermit, his critical intel, and his escape route.

With all of the chaos going on as each Survivor makes their way through the town to complete their mission, the gameplay could get a little too intense for some people's liking. Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game utilizes a completely customizable experience so that players can create the best scenario that is tailored to how they want to enjoy their game. Removing certain aspects of the game like Hazard Zombies or Plume counters can greatly reduce the amount of suspenseful buildup that could turn players off from a game that could potentially be nearly impossible to win. Inventory management and play deck building are also ways a group of players can ease the difficulty and ensure that the game, if played with all the right moves and strategic plans, can indeed be won without laying at the mercy of the Countdown or the roll of a die.

The board game, at its core, is designed for 2-8 players. However, like Infectious Contagion, the board game also allows a single player to enjoy the game experience as the lone survivor of Endicott’s shift from living to undead. Other game modes include a point-based Survivor mode that removes the Countdown and many other aspects of the game to allow players (or factions/teams of players) to battle waves of Undead, tallying up points at the end of each round and crowning a winner after a set amount of battles. Or, players (or teams) can simply battle each other without the inclusion of Zombies (but with a Countdown) in a vastly customizable VS mode.

A ticking time-bomb's clock, swarms of Undead that will chain themselves together to create deadly hordes, an ever-spreading toxic plume beneath your feet, stealthy Black Ops agents that mark you for execution when you fall within their sights, a limited number of resources that must be used in conjunction with an even more limited inventory system, a constant surge of adrenaline with every roll of the Intrigue cubes, making allies with your fellow Survivors only to find your group surrounded by Zombies with only two bullets and a grenade...all of this and more is what builds your game up from a simple beginning to an all-out epic battle for survival. Think you can handle it?

108965.name: Undead Empire
108965.description:
User Summary

A top down zombie shooter that features a story and survival mode, as well as co-op play for up to four players. Choose from six playable characters each with their own bonus. Aim by moving the right stick and fire with R and throw grenades with L. The game features many different weapons that can be purchased and upgraded at the games shop.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace.

108966.name: Dandy
108966.description:
User Summary

A brightly colored adventure. You fly through the air on your giant lollipop, shooting villains and collect all the candy you can.

108967.name: Days 2 Die
108967.description:
User Summary

Protect various levels from being overrun by zombies. Build barricades, hire other survivors, buy better weapons, and as you play some of your stats will increase in power.

108968.name: Days 2 Die: The Other Side
108968.description:
User Summary

You must try to rescue survivors from the zombie hordes, and it would be better if you stayed alive yourself! Control Sgt. Vic Radel as he and the SWAT team move from level to level, killing zombies all the while.

108969.name: King Rupert
108969.description:
Game is about Kings and Evil wizards! What do you need more? 30 unique levels and LEVEL EDITOR! Emerge into physics based action adventure!

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary

An evil wizard has cursed King Rupert into becoming...a ball?! Tilt your iPhone or iPad to roll King Rupert across a series of levels, collecting power ups and dodging enemies. Only you can restore his humanity!

108970.name: Cosmic Odyssey
108970.description:
Join the Exploration League of Humanity (ELH) for a thrilling exploration of the galaxy. Discover new planets, moons, and space stations as the most technologically advanced exploration carrier of the ELH, the Arcturus, travels from star system to star system.

Each planet the Arcturus travels to plays out as a round where only one card may be played per player. Earn exploration credits by contributing the most to exploring the planet or give yourself an edge by upgrading your starship with new weapons and systems. You can even become the ambassador to foreign space stations, helping you build even better starships to captain.

At the end of the game, the player with the most exploration credits wins the game.

108971.name: Mass Effect 2 - Arrival

videogamehonor.31271: 2011 Spike Best DLC of the Year Nominee

108971.description:
User Summary

Taking place after the main plot of Mass Effect 2, Arrival provides an additional mission in Commander Shepard's attempts to thwart the Reaper invasion. What begins as a rescue mission for a human scientist escalates into a race against time as Shepard discovers an imminent Reaper attack on a vital resource. Arrival provides a unique experience by forcing Shepard to perform the mission without squadmates, and is the final downloadable episode for Mass Effect 2.

108972.name: Zombie Crisis 3D
108972.description:
User Summary

A bio-accident has transformed the staff of the Argo Company into bloodthirsty zombies. To contain the disaster, the government is sending a mercenary, Dana, who is instructed to investigate the situation at Argo's lab.

Zombie Crisis is a "light gun" shooter, in the style of House of the Dead, that you play with your finger on your iPhone/iPad. The game controls your movement; you control where you shoot. With crisp 3D graphics and unrelenting waves of the undead, Zombie Crisis delivers an intense but portable shooting experience.

108973.name: Zombie Crisis 3D: Prologue
108973.description:
User Summary

Zombie Crisis 3D:Prologue is the prequel to Zombie Crisis 3D. You play Terry, a former research object in Dr. Tasker's lab before the viral outbreak that begins Zombie Crisis 3D. You escape just as the virus begins infecting the staff. Now you must battle your way to freedom.

But you are not a normal person. Because of Dr. Tasker's cruel experiments, you can control objects with your mind.

In this unusual light-shooter game, instead of using a gun, you instead hurl knives that you can redirect in mid-air.

108974.name: Zombie Crisis 3D 2: HUNTER
108974.description:
User Summary

Unlike its predecessors, Zombie Crisis 3D 2: HUNTER is a dual-stick shooter.

The game takes place concurrently with Zombie Crisis 3D. While in that earlier game you played Dana, who breaks into Argo Company to determine the source of the zombie outbreak, in Zombie Crisis 3D 2: HUNTER, you play her partner Fox, who is investigating the same outbreak, but in different areas. Control powerful weapons to ward off swarms of attacking zombies across more than a dozen areas.

108975.name: Zombie Crisis 3: Killzone
108975.description:
User Summary

Like Zombie Crisis 3D 2: HUNTER, this game is a dual-stick shooter.

The zombie plague has spread outside of Argo Lab and into the nearby City of Perseus, after somebody poisoned the water supply. Fox (from the second game) and Dana (from the first game) must work together to eliminate all the zombies.

FEATURES

25 powerful weapons
20 zombies per screen
Epic boss battles
3D graphics and premium sound effects
Lighting and shadowing effects with rich details and textures

108976.name: Heaven & Earth
108976.description:
From the back of the book:

In the small town of Potter's Lake lies a secret. A secret of conspiracy. A secret of darkness. The secret of the true nature of the universe and human destiny. Now, that secret is about to be uncovered. And nothing will ever be the same again.

You are a resident of Potter's Lake. You must discover that nothing you ever believed in was wholly true. You will help decide the final fate of humanity in the coming Apocolypse.

ARE YOU READY TO TOSS THE DICE?

Forget the dice! Heaven & Earth features Event Horizon's brand new diceless, deterministic action resolution system. It's just you, your skill, and your destiny against the machinations of a universe that is not what it seems. There's nothing random about that. Take hold of your destiny or have it decided for you. Forever.

108977.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 12
108977.description:
Experience the PGA TOUR like a pro!

See how you stack up with real PGA TOUR pros like Tiger Woods, Anthony Kim, Paula Creamer, Natalie Gulbis, Paul Casey, Jim Furyk, Zach Johnson, and Camilo Villegas. Even create your own male or female golfer with more custom options than ever.

Play a quick solo round, go head-to-head via Wifi or Bluetooth multiplayer, or enter PGA TOUR Mode. Take on the TIGER CHALLENGE and casually hone your skills with over 20 mini-games and unlock special prizes! Then, shoot it out with Facebook friends in the innovative “Closest to the Pin” challenges featured on selected holes throughout the game.

Tee off from the Championship tees of 8 stellar courses, including Pebble Beach, St. Andrews, TPC Sawgrass, Hazeltine, Doral, Greenbrier, TPC Boston, and the ALL-NEW PREDATOR – a true fantasy course come to life! Enhanced graphic quality lets you soak in the feeling of standing on the world’s finest fairways. Meanwhile, smoother and more precise touch control let you attack the greens and sink that clutch birdie putt in winning style.

Features

Play in 4 Game Modes
Choose your course, golfer, difficulty level, the front 9, or back 9 and tee off in Play Now mode
Choose your course and golfer, and play against other scores in PGA TOUR mode
Take on the Tiger Challenge, consisting of over 20 mini-games designed to test your skills -- earn money that can be used to participate in PGA TOUR events.
Go head-to-head against a fiend with local WiFi or Bluetooth Multiplayer
Shoot it out with Facebook friends with “Closest to the Pin” found on selected holes throughout the game
Play through PGA TOUR courses, including Pebble Beach, St. Andrews, TPC Sawgrass, Hazeltine, Doral, TPC Boston, and Greenbrier
Play the all-new Predator fantasy course
Play as or alongside 8 pros, including Tiger Woods, Anthony Kim, Paula Creamer, Natalie Gulbis, Paul Casey, Jim Furyk, Zach Johnson, Camilo Villegas
Customize your golfer, male or female, with skin, shirt, pants, hat, shoes, belts, and gloves




Source: The Game Website.

108979.name: QAGS the Quick Ass Game System (First Edition)
108979.description:
From the back of the book:

GAMING FOR GROWNUPS

We at Hex Games know you're a busy person. You've got bills to pay, work to do, and not a lot of time to spend on games. When you role-play, you want to have a fun and exciting experience, not spend hours looking up rules and cross-referencing charts. QAGS' adaptability and unique candy-based mechanics allow you to play exactly the game you want with just a few minutes' preparation and without any adolescent posturing or number-crunching. Whether you want to run a short and silly game or an epic story, QAGS will meet your needs. The witty, sometimes irreverent, and always entertaining writing style of QAGS makes it almost as much fun to read as to play.

108980.description:
Splice is an evolution of Spline that can be played with a Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in three colours (white, black and red).

Start: The board starts empty.

Play: Players take turns placing either:

1) a ball of their colour on any hole or any platform that contains
at least one red ball, or

2) a red ball on any hole or any platform.

End: A player wins by making a flat line spanning side to side, or
corner to corner, on any level, composed entirely of friendly and
neutral balls (at least one of each).

If the placement of a red ball achieves this for both players, then
the mover wins.

Strategy: White should place at least one red ball on the board level,
otherwise Black can force a win due to parity. White should defend
this red ball so that Black can’t exploit it.
108980.name: Splice

108981.description:
Spoing is a capture game that can be played with a Shibumi set , as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in three colours (white, black and red).

Setup:

Place 8 black balls and 8 white balls according to this figure. Red balls are considered ‘neutral’:

● ● ● ●
● ● ● ●
○ ○ ○ ○
○ ○ ○ ○

Rules:

Two players, White and Black, alternate turns moving a ball of their colour or a neutral ball (red) to jump over a single ball of another colour and land on any ball to capture it. Jumps may be diagonal (as per Checkers) or orthogonal. Players must capture a ball each turn.
The ball landed on is removed and the ball jumped over is converted to the colour that is not the jumper or the jumpee, e.g. if the jumper is a white ball and the jumpee is a black ball then the jumpee gets replaced with a neutral ball (red).

The game ends immediately when a player can't move on their turn (which could happen if there are not three balls in a row somewhere, or if all remaining triples are unusable by the player). The winner is the player with the most balls of their colour on the board.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
108981.name: Spoing

108982.description:
Sphex is a connection game that can be played with a Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and black).

Rules: The board starts empty. The opening player places one ball of their colour, then players take turns placing two balls of their colour on legal positions (holes or platforms). The mover can additionally place a neutral ball on their turn, in any order.

Aim: A player wins by connecting any two opposite sides of the board level with a chain of their balls. Balls connect if they touch, i.e. orthogonally adjacent or resting upon each other.
108982.name: Sphex

108984.name: One Two Three Quiz
108984.description:
A simple trivia party game.
12 sheets of different questions are provided. During a pause at your party, you can hold an imprompu quiz. The winner is the one who gets the most right answers

108985.name: Here On Business
108985.description:
Publisher's blurb:


So what kind of a game can I whip up in under an hour and fit on the back of a business card? A role-playing game, obviously. It's called Here On Business, it's set at a conference, and it's designed to play out in 30-60 minutes.



I admit I had to resort to 6-point type, and it's pretty freeform, but I think it works. Let me know what you reckon, and whether I should do a separate run of cards with a skill and combat system on it.

108986.name: Find the Mistakes
108986.description:
Party game. There are 15 sheets, with three pictures on each sheet. Guests are given a sheet each and, during the evening, must study the pictures and make a list of all the things wrong with each picture. For instance, a man might be holding an unopened umbrella but he is holding the umbrelly upside down.
The guest with the most correct observations, wins.

108987.name: Forfeits
108987.description: Party game. Players are asked trivia questions to score points but if they get an answer wrong, they must do a forfeit. The one who avoids the most forfeits, wins

108988.name: Doubles
108988.description: Party game. Each guest is handed a picture. As they mingle during the evening, they try to match their picture. The first to be successful, wins.

108989.name: Errand Time

boardgameversion.267953: Party Games Publishers white surround edition

108989.description: Children's party game. Each child is given a shopping list and an article card. The object is that each child will ask other guests what their article is. If that article is on their shopping list, then they can mark it off. First to complete their shopping list, wins

108990.name: Number Please
108990.description:
Party Game. Guests are given a card. During the evening, you will be given clues by other guests as to the telephone number you are trying to find. The first guest to guess their telephone number correctly, wins
(By the way, in the 50's you didn't just have a number, you have a place-name that comes before the number e.g. Maida Vale 1234 would be a possible number).

108991.description:
Foundations is a 2 players abstract strategy game that is played using board and pieces of an Isaac set.

The aim of the game is getting rid of the value of your pieces by carefully placing them on the board or on already played pieces, thus creating a tridimensional structure developed on different levels.

Players take turns placing one of their pieces in ascending order of length. If they can't find space for a piece, they must build on the next level in height so that both ends of the piece rest on top of two pieces of its same colour.

When players are forced to build on new levels, they can begin with a smaller piece, but they must then play again in ascending order of length and they cannot play in lower levels anymore.

The game ends when players cannot place any more pieces on the board. The winner is the player with less points still in hand. In case of a tie, the winner is the player with less points at the highest level on the board.
108991.name: Foundations

108992.name: Playmates
108992.description:
Children's party game.
Each child is given an answer sheet and must try to find out the ages of the other guests. This encourages social skills as you probe for answers. The first to complete their record sheet, wins.

108993.name: Split Wits
108993.description:
Two party games in one box.
The first. Each guest gets half a head picture and must find their other half to make a complete head. First to do so, wins
The second. Each guest is given a card with a word on it. They must then find another guest's word that will form a correct longer word when you link the two words together. First to do so, wins.

108994.name: Hari
108994.description:
Hari is a 2 players abstract strategy game that is played using board and pieces of an Isaac set.

Players take turns sliding, discarding and placing their pieces in order to have the most points on the board.

Pieces must be used in ascending order of length and sacrifice short pieces to make room for longer ones is often required to achieve victory.

108995.name: Roy of the Rovers
108995.description:
User Summary

You are Roy, super striker of Melchester Rovers on the eve of an important celebrity charity match organised to save your club. The problem is that your entire team has mysteriously disappeared. Your task is to find them before the big event or you'll be facing the opposition alone. So you must do some serious investigative work through the streets of Melchester, avoid traps and ambushes and locate your teammates. You can then take on the opposition on equal terms. You hold the destiny of your team in your hands!

108996.name: Pussy
108996.description: Action game. The cat board has two holes, one worth 2 points, the other 4 points. Players take turns in trying to throw a ball into the cat's mouth. If you are successful, you score the points depending on which hole the ball comes out from. The one who scores the most points, wins.

108997.name: War Planes A Card Game for Aircraft Spotters
108997.description:
A box of Second World War aircraft identification cards titled 'War Planes - A Card Game for Aircraft Spotters'. The game was a Quartet game but with the unusual difference that the sets were not equal. The thrifty government, at the outbreak of war, ensured that players could also use the cards for regular card games by taking out the extra suit of 13 cards.
The pack comprises of 67 cards organised as follows:
65 illustrated cards representing five different views each of thirteen British and German aircraft, and two 'Key' cards.

It was intended that Spotters, at airfields or on the roofs of London buildings, could practice recognising aircraft to improve their skills.

108998.name: Matchomino
108998.description:
Contents: 90 square cards, cardboard stands, score pad & pencil

Each player receives 7 tiles. The remaining tiles form the face-down draw pile. One tile is turned face up, and the start player tries to match a tile from their hand to the face-up tile so that one edge matches. The next player then tries to match one or more edges etc. Black is a blocking colour and cannot be matched.

If a player manages to make a match, the score is the sum of the printed-on values of the tile they placed plus those of the tiles that this tile now is adjacent to. Some tiles have stars, these double the value of the edge that the edge showing the star is matched with.

If a player cannot match a tile on their turn, they draw another tile and game continues with the next player.

Once one player runs out of tiles, all other players get one more turn after which the values of their remaining tiles are deducted from their scores. Highest score wins.

108999.name: Nochtschicht
108999.description:
The players represent members of a band. After a concert, they try to spend their whole salary from the gig. The goal of the game is to spend all your earned money, accumulate 8 hours of time cards, and go to your apartment.

The game is played by moving your pawn over a mapboard, showing the city of Vienna, overlayed with a grid. On your turn, you may move your pawn one or two spaces by foot, or three or four spaces by taxi, the latter costs money. You try to visit event locations (like Rosie's Café, your band's rehearsal room, a hot dog booth and various others). On most spaces you have to draw cards, which will help you to spend money and acquire time cards.

The trick is to keep the right balance between spending money and acquiring time cards. You need at least 8 hours worth of time cards, then you can try to get to your apartment and win the game - but only if you have no money left.

This game's pawns represent members of a locally known band in Austria; the title is Viennese slang and translates to "night shift".

109000.description: Its Pitzelpatz (a teddy bear) birthday! You want all 6 guests to come. For this 2 players each get a house and then try to use the colour die to pick the appropriately coloured guest. The first one to roll all 6 colours and thus get all 6 guests to his house wins.
109000.name: Pitzelpatz Geburtstags-Party

108501.name: Scary Secret
108501.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fast and Fun, that’s the goal of Avalon Game’s Pathfinder line of Adventures. Each issue will bring you a small adventure, one that can be dropped into any campaign, used as a single one shot night of fun, or turned into a more complex and longer series of adventures. The goal is to give GM’s something that will bring an easy night of fun to their game, without having to cost and arm and a leg doing so.

Don’t wait, get all the adventure you will even need and come sit at the Round Table of Fun with Avalon Games.

108502.name: The Magician's Tower
108502.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fast and Fun, that’s the goal of Avalon Game’s Pathfinder line of Adventures. Each issue will bring you a small adventure, one that can be dropped into any campaign, used as a single one shot night of fun, or turned into a more complex and longer series of adventures. The goal is to give GM’s something that will bring an easy night of fun to their game, without having to cost and arm and a leg doing so.

Don’t wait, get all the adventure you will even need and come sit at the Round Table of Fun with Avalon Games.

108503.name: The Raven Prince
108503.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something to spice up your game, but you are all out of ideas, well Avalon Game’s Pathfinder series is here. Yep we have done all the work for you, so all you have to do is run the game. Use Avalon Characters as a one off encounter for your players, or as a reoccurring NPC, one which will add fun and excitement to your game time after time. Ever better, each character is designed to be used as a Play Character Background should you feel like adding their story to your game. Versatile, and fun, this and other issues in the Avalon Pathfinder line are sure to fulfill your gaming needs each and every time.

This first issue offer you the Raven Prince, a great NPc to add spice to your great game.

Don’t wait, get all the characters you will even need and come sit at the Round Table of Fun with Avalon Games.

108514.name: Dig & Spike Volleyball
108514.description:
Dig & Spike Volleyball - known as Volleyball Twin (バレーボールTwin) in Japan - is a volleyball video game. The player can choose either two variations: Men's indoor volleyball and Women's beach volleyball.

The indoor variation is represented by eight men's national volleyball teams:

Algeria
Brazil
Cuba
Italy
Japan
Netherlands
Russia
United States

Source: Wikipedia, "Dig & Spike Volleyball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108516.name: Dirt Racer
108516.description:
In Dirt Racer, players must drive their vehicle across a road rally. The car comes complete with a speedometer (in kilometres), a lap counter, and a lap time counter. There are a pre-determined number of chances to complete the game, like in Super Mario Kart and F-Zero. If the player is unable to defeat the game in those number of tries, then the player gets an automatic game over. A yellow smiley face shows up to track the performance of the driver. If it's smiling, then the player is winning. Otherwise, the player is losing the game.

Dirt Racer uses the Super FX chip to provide enhanced graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dirt Racer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108517.name: Doomsday Warrior
108517.description:
Doomsday Warrior (対決！！ブラスナンバーズ, lit. "Taiketsu!! Brass Numbers") was released during the fighting game craze of the early 1990s. It is very similar to Street Fighter II copycat but with a storyline emulated from Japanese anime.

Source: Wikipedia, "Doomsday Warrior (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108518.name: Emmitt Smith Football
108518.description:
Emmitt Smith is former Cowboys all-pro running back Emmitt Smith. Like Troy Aikman NFL Football, the player can make his own plays. Most of the text in this game uses a classic video game typeface.

Possible modes of play include: exhibition mode and season mode. Smith added his voice on the game; giving positive comments on big gains and negative comments on negative plays. Most of the standard rules of the National Football League at the time of release are used (four quarters of 15 minutes, 100 yard field, etc.). However, the options allow the player to change some of the rules used in the actual game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Emmitt Smith Football", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108519.name: ESPN Baseball Tonight
108519.description:
ESPN Baseball Tonight is licensed by MLB, but not by the Players Association, so while actual team names and logos are used, no player names are in the game.

The lead programmers for the project were Alexander Ehrath and Russel Shanks who wrote the game's simulation engine. The game featured video clips of Chris Berman and play-by-play audio from Dan Patrick.

Little Caesars Enterprises, Inc. got involved with the development of the game, seeing marketing synergy between baseball fans and pizza eaters. A large promotion was rolled out by the pizza chain to coincide with the game's launch, including point-of-purchase material at 4,500 stores; a mail-in offer for an ESPN "Best of Sports" videotape; and print advertising. The director of marketing for Sony called what Little Caesars received "a new method to reach families and men, 18-34, in a nontraditional, nonintrusive way". The stadium walls in-game featured large Little Caesars advertising.

It was the first in a series of ESPN-themed sports games. The next to be released was ESPN Sunday Night NFL

Source: Wikipedia, "ESPN Baseball Tonight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108520.name: ESPN National Hockey Night

videogameversion.191388: North American Game Boy Color edition

108520.description:
In ESPN National Hockey Night, the player is cast right straight into NHL action on his TV screen. Like most ESPN games, there is an exhibition mode, a season mode, and a playoff mode.

The AI of this game is very difficult, like a hockey equivalent of Super Bases Loaded. The side view makes it more tricky and the computer opponent can sneak in goals when the player thinks that he is secure in a tied game or in a game in which he is narrowly winning. Most of the notable NHL players from the 1990s are here complete with stats to make them more realistic.

Source: Wikipedia, "ESPN National Hockey Night (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

This game is not to be confused with the game ESPN National Hockey Night which is for Playstation 2 and is a different game.

108521.name: ESPN Speed World
108521.description:
ESPN Speed World is a Super NES and Sega Genesis video game. The cover art has the sponsors and the manufacturers of the race cars airbrushed out due to licensing concerns. While they use the 1969 Ford Fairlane racing chassis, it is impossible to make out which vehicles belong to either the Chevrolet, Ford, or the now-defunct Pontiac brand name. There are not even decals to remind the player that these are NASCAR Cup Series vehicles. This also had the side effect of attracting gamers who are interested in cars in general, not just fans of stock car racing. The title screen of the video game was partially inspired by the 1993 running of the First Union 400 racing event.

The game involves the player controlling NASCAR Winston Cup stock cars as they do laps around various oval tracks, road courses, and superspeedways that are based on the actual NASCAR circuits of the 1990s.

All stock cars in the game have the capability to go up to 200 miles per hour (approximately 322 kilometers per hour). The object of the game is to get as close to first place as possible. This game uses Dr. Jerry Punch and an interactive pit crew to simulate the feeling of racing during the 1993 Winston Cup season Like in most racing games, being in the top positions gives the player more points than being in the bottom positions. Stock cars can be customized with a choice of colors and styles. The real-life drivers of this era are missing because the game only has an ESPN license and not an official NASCAR license

Source: Wikipedia, "ESPN Speed World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108522.name: ESPN Sunday Night NFL
108522.description:
ESPN Sunday Night NFL is a Super NES, Sega CD, and Sega Genesis sports video game that takes the fun and excitement of Sunday night NFL action and places it in a 16-bit video game console. Like in other football games, the player must run, pass, and/or kick a ball across a 100-yard field in order to score points. It was the second in a chain of ESPN-themed sports games, following ESPN Baseball Tonight.

Source: Wikipedia, "ESPN Sunday Night NFL", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108523.name: Vengeance Crusaders vs. The Monads
108523.description:
This is a tactical space combat game in the Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars series, and includes the second edition rulebook for that game (as a series rulebook).

From a GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


This pits the Fast Omega Ship "Formidable" Class, their Deadly Alpha Battleship "Victorious" Class, and their Fast Beta Battle Cruiser "Vengeance" Class, against the "Odin" and "Thor" Class Dreadnaught with its Monadian Web and the Thor Battleships' Death Ray and Satellite Defensive systems. This game consists of a reliving of the Famous Battles with the Great Admirals, Star Marshals, and Battleship Conmanders in various Historical Engagements that occurred during the Monad Wars - the Exploits of the Black Prince, the Xenon Battle Cruiser "ACE" that had 20 "kills" to his Credit, etc. Includes the Famous Scenario "The Charge Against the Monad Star Base", and the "Battle of Masters". This Game is the Companion Game to the BFA game "Star Wars of the Xenon Empire". Vengeance Crusaders is the opposite of Sun Slayers: it is the active seeking of enemy vessels and smashing them in individual encounters and small fleet engagements. In the first game the knowledge of weapons systems is vital; in this one Maneuver is paramount - weapons only second!

108524.name: Zouave 2
108524.description:
Miniature Wargame Rules for Warfare in the Age of Transition 1861-1871

Zouave 2 is a revised version of Zouave, a member of the Repique System, and the latest miniatures rule set by Bob Jones of Piquet fame.

Unlike Zouave, Zouave 2 uses a rondel system for command control.

The game offers command level and grand tactical options, for 6mm to 28mm miniatures.

The period covers the ACW, but also the Franco Prussian War, 1866 and the Maximilian Adventure.

108525.name: Die Fighting II
108525.description:
Horse and Musket miniatures rules for the period 1700 to 1900.

This is an innovative set of miniatures rules that uses both cards and dice to control various aspects of tactical battles, designed by Bob Jones of Piquet and Zouave fame.

Play templates are provided to enable several wars within the period to be played immediately, while the players can easily adapt and modify other periods or even the base rules.

The rules allow for a tactical scale battle and will work with most figure sizes, with the emphasis on 28mm.

Update: The game has been reissued as Die Fighting II with many improvements and new mechanisms. It is now in a Enhanced DVD Multimedia format which includes a 1 hour professionally produced and chaptered video; a slide show in both PDF and Quick Time Movie formats, and printable PDFs which include templates for a wide variety of periods from 1699-1902, player aids, Phase cards,a Rule Summary keyed to the video and slide show, and several other player aids.

108526.name: Action Hero (OpenD6 Edition)
108526.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cars race through the streets and bullets fly endlessly in the world of thrilling fights and non-stop action.

Action Hero contains everything that you need to transport your game into the exhilarating world of your favorite action movies. Car chases, shoot'em ups, and plenty of raw adrenaline are what you'll find in this high octane genre. This is the ultimate guide for players and game masters who want to crank their action adventure games up to the next level. Action and adventure are the key staples of role-playing games but it can be a challenge to keep up with the pace of an action movie or video game shooter. Running a game of non-stop action and roller coaster thrill presents a GM with unique challenges. Action Hero helps make this easier with advice on crafting plots and capturing the feel of a thrill a minute action movie or first person shooter. Crafting a memorable action sequence isn't easy but this book provides plenty of ways to help; from plot hooks and pacing to exotic locations and exciting finales. The game never has to slow down as your players wade through endless hordes of henchmen or escape from terrifying monsters.

Action Hero provides gamers with:

GM advice for capturing the feel of the action genre; including the script, pacing, cliffhangers, action sequences, the cast, and more!
New Drawbacks
Random Encounter Chart with four custom NPCs
Major villains with complete stats, perfect for any action game
Fifty random storylines for the action genre

108527.name: Action Hero (Pathfinder Edition)
108527.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cars race through the streets and bullets fly endlessly in the world of thrilling fights and non-stop action.

Action Hero contains everything that you need to transport your game into the exhilarating world of your favorite action movies. Car chases, shoot'em ups, and plenty of raw adrenaline are what you'll find in this high octane genre. This is the ultimate guide for players and game masters who want to crank their action adventure games up to the next level. Action and adventure are the key staples of role-playing games but it can be a challenge to keep up with the pace of an action movie or video game shooter. Running a game of non-stop action and roller coaster thrill presents a GM with unique challenges. Action Hero helps make this easier with advice on crafting plots and capturing the feel of a thrill a minute action movie or first person shooter. Crafting a memorable action sequence isn't easy but this book provides plenty of ways to help; from plot hooks and pacing to exotic locations and exciting finales. The game never has to slow down as your players wade through endless hordes of henchmen or escape from terrifying monsters.

Players will be able to get the most out of their action characters with new advanced classes. The book also includes new skills and feats, as well as an in depth discussion of which skills and feats are most useful in an action game. You will also find for making a character into an “action star,” a special character with unique benefits and disadvantages.

Action Hero, Pathfinder Version provides gamers with:

GM advice for capturing the feel of the action genre; including the script, pacing, cliffhangers, action sequences, the cast, and more!
Six new Advanced Classes
New Skills and Feats
New Drawbacks
Random Encounter Chart with four custom NPCs
